abstract: K.K.R., whose shares will start trading on the New York Stock Exchange today, is seeking to raise $800 million to invest in China, Bloomberg News reports.
snippet: K.K.R., whose shares will start trading on the New York Stock Exchange today, is seeking to raise $800 million to invest in China, Bloomberg News reports.
lead_paragraph: Kohlberg Kravis Roberts, whose shares will start trading on the New York Stock Exchange today, is seeking to raise $800 million to invest in China, Asia’s biggest private- equity market, Bloomberg News reported, citing two people with knowledge of the matter.

headline.main: K.K.R. Said to Raise $800 Million for China Fund
